[h1]Half-Life: Valve's Triumph[/h1]

There's really nothing to say about Half-Life that hasn't already been said. It introduced a fairly streamlined single-player experience with fps combat, some tricky platforming and the occasional puzzle, all wrapped up in a nice physics engine. The complex and simple AI behaviors that were coded are a delight to observe. Foes will flee and regroup to improve their odds, soldiers will reposition and lob grenades with great effect, and cockroaches will flee light sources. If I could highlight the most troubling aspect of this game, I would say that the levels in Xen are a little difficult to navigate. Otherwise, I would say this game is definitely worth the price of admission.

I really wanted to like this game. I have heard all about how Half Life is one of the best games ever made, and how people still want a Half Life 3 after all these years, so i decided to give it a try. I can't find myself getting into it though. I will list my main issues, but also give some positive marks because the game still does do some things right.
The Negative:
-While I do agree that this game is fantastic for coming out in 1998, it has not aged particularly well. The gun play feels clunky. I dont mean in the sense of comparing it to a game from 2018, I mean even comparing it Halo: Combat Evolved, a game that came out only a few years later the gunplay feels stiff. I'm not being nostalgia blind in that comparison either since i played that game for the first time in 2015. I honestly feel like the gunfights feel better in Fallout 3, A game that is often critiqued for and known for having pretty bad gun play.
-The sound design feels... a bit off. I get that black mesa is an underground facility but why does every sound you here while you are inside have so much reverb? I will give it this though, the Assault Rifle sounds great.
-The controls are good most of the time, but when i want to make precise movements, it feels like i am moving on ice.

The Positive:
-The way the game delivers its story through gameplay rather than cutscenes is a cool idea, though i couldnt really get into the story myself.
-The modding scene for this game is out of this world. If you are like me and you can't really get into the vanilla story, there is nearly an endless supply of fan made content where you can find something you do. You can even get a "Brutal" mod that helps to modernize weapon balance, animation and sounds.

In conclusion this game was good. For 1998 that is. As revolutionary as some of the mechanics this game brought to the table are, I can't overlook its flaws. If you want to see a stepping stone in game technology, or go on a nostalgia trip because you grew up with this game, then go for it, but i personally can't see what all the hype is about. If you want to play a classic FPS that sitll holds up, then try the original DOOM.

I just finished this game, and it has really raised my expectation for story FPS games. I was expecting something good, as I like other valve games such as TF2 and Portal 2. Half-Life é um jogo que mesmo depois de seus 20 anos é difícil de se igualar á sua grandeza.
Criado pela Valve, sendo seu primeiro jogo, Half-Life chegou inovando em quase todos seus aspectos, numa uma indústria saturada por clones de doom mal feitos, Half-Life aumentou os padrões do gênero FPS.

[h1]Gráficos.[/h1]
 Só de olhar uma captura de tela é fácil perceber que os gráficos de Half-Life não envelheceram bem.
O que na época eram considerados gráficos realistas como a vida, hoje são comparáveis aqueles de Roblox. De fato, por mais que todos os outros aspectos do jogo continuem tão efetivos quanto no seu lançamento, podemos dizer que os gráficos não entram  exatamente nessa lista,porém, os gráficos não arrúinarão sua experiência com o jogo, e se você estiver á procura de uma experiêencia de  Half-Life com gráficos melhorados, recomendo o remake feito do zero por fãs, Black Mesa (Também disponível na Steam.)

[h1]Jogabilidade.[/h1]
A jogabilidade de Half-Life é um equilíbrio perfeito entre divertida e desafiante.
Com controles surpreendentimente funcionais para um jogo originalmente lançado em 1998, O jogo se comporta de forma bizarramente similar á um FPS moderno. O jogo tem você  matando alienígenas e militares e resolvendo quebra cabeças para avançar um enredo contado de forma contínua, ou seja Half-Life não tem cutscenes, nunca tirando  o controle do jogador sobre o protagonista.

[h1]História.[/h1]
Half-Life possui uma história engajante, que te faz ficar grudado ao computador por horas querendo saber qual será o próximo acontecimento. Em Half-Life você assume o controle de Gordon Freeman, Um físico teórico formado no MIT em seu primeiro dia  de trabalho, no centro de pesquisa da Black Mesa. Tudo ocorre normalmente até que um acidente acontece no teste em que Gordon participava, que envolvia um elemento instável. Dito acidente causa uma cascata de ressonâncias , liberando alienígenas da dimensão Xen nos laboratórios da Black Mesa, Restando assim para Gordon o trabalho de escapar a facilidade.

[h1]Apresentação.[/h1]
Half-Life é um jogo que, especialmente rodando em sistemas modernos pode ser meio bruto em sua apresentação.
A apresentação de Half-Life, por mais que aceitável para a época, pode ser meio estranha nos dias de hoje, porém, assim como com os gráficos não vai te empedir de aproveitar o jogo, por exemplo, eu só encontrei um bug grave uma vez na minha jogatina inteira, que mesmo assim foi fácil de concertar, porém, existem erros que poderiam ter sido evitados, como a imagem de fundo do menu principal ficando esticada se a resolução for ajustada para 16:9, por exemplo. Fora esses, entrtanto, a apresentação continua como era em sua data de lançamento: simples, porém efetiva.

[h1]Veredito[/h1]
Half-Life é um jogo que, mesmo tendo 20 anos de idade ainda é um clássico, divertido e engajante,  que deve ser jogado por todo gamer pelo menos uma vez em sua vida

[h1]Nota final:[/h1] [b]9/10![/b]

Перед тем как написать обзор на данную игру. Хочу сказать, что первый раз я запустил игру из серии "Half-Life" в детстве это был пиратский диск «Half-Life Дыхание ксена», но проблема в том, что эта версия шла на двух дисках и по иронии у меня был только один и им оказалась даже не вторая часть, а второй эпизод. Но даже не смотря на это игра мне очень понравилась.
После этой "нужной " предыстории можно приступить к обзору.
Если честно не ждал от игры, что то дельное. Начал судить предвзята из-за возраста данного творения(на момент написания обзора эта цифра равна 20).И думал, что потрачу на неё чуть больше 3 часов. Не буду ничего говорить о графике в 1998 она смотрелась восхитительно.
Как же я ошибался!
Half-Life - является чем то невероятным и незабываемым. После первой половины игры ты погружаешься в этот мир с головой и не хочешь покидать его. Мне понравилось многое, а именно сюжет, который прописан от и до и заканчивая геймплеем и механикой игры. Так же могу выделить большое разнообразие оружия начиная с монтировки и заканчивая Глюонной пушкой.Персонажи, конечно скудны на модели, но радует, что со всеми можно взаимодействовать. Они могут оказать вам свою помощь, а если вы нападёте сопротивление и даже могут убить.
Если подводить итоги игра меня удивила. И даже спустя 20 лет играется  на ура!

классика

It took me longer than it should've for me to finally play Half Life, I was always curious as to why people loved this game so much, and I can now see why.

By far one of the greatest FPS games to ever exist. It tells the story with a unique narrative and will always keep you wanting to play till the end. The games weapons are satisfying and fun to use, and in many fast paced situations you're going to have to learn which weapons work best and how to engage a problem properly, Whether its small pesky headcrabs to the more organized HECU forces, meaning tactics are a key. Now some parts of this game got difficult even on easy, but are still doable and this games puzzles never get boring (at least for me). The characters in this game even without any explained backstory still feel real and this game excels at making you feel like you're apart of the whole incident that occurs. This is greately helped by the fact that Gordon Freeman (The character you play as) doesn't talk, meaning that you can put yourself in his shoes alot easier. Another thing to mention is that the AI and their behaviours are very detailed, and though hard to notice, is very very cool (An example is the houndeye's coordinated pack attacks and how they'll actually fall asleep while the pack leader keeps watch)

As for negative things, the games physics engine while great at the time of its release, is outdated now and pushing objects like crates around can get quite annoying but it doesn't affect the gameplay a whole lot at all. Platforming in this game is a little hard but completely doable and pretty satisfying if you pull it off well. The negative things with this game is very few and insignificant to it's pros.

Why is this game one of the greatest FPSs of all time? I dunno. I don't play FPS games, and I don't know the history of FPS games.
What I can tell you is that this game notably has no cutscenes. Gordon never speaks, and you are allowed to freely move unless... spoilery things happen. It gives a deeper level of immersion that other FPS games won't give you. But it's not a survival game, so don't expect it to be [i]that[/i] deep.
Half Life has the plot of a cheesy B movie. An enjoyably cheesy B movie. A science thing goes wrong and aliens attack because of some scientific-sounding jibber jabber. The military comes and kills the scientists as well as the aliens. It's up to you to save the world. And there's a weird dude in a suit who's walking out of reach in the levels and seems to be unaffected by the chaos around him. I wonder who he is... [spoiler] why am i trying to not spoil a 20 year old game and not name the most famous character in the series [/spoiler]
The game has a more ambient soundtrack that occasionally transitions to rock music for the exciting moments, there's plenty of guns for you to use besides the famous crowbar, and it's fun to play despite the old graphics and the bad sound quality for the voices.
Half Life is totally worth the buy.

First thing to remember is that this game is 20 years old, which means I am 20 years older OMG where did the time go? Original discs now long gone, but recently purchased the whole original collection for a few £s in the Steam Sale and decided to revisit a piece of gaming history.

Still an absolute classic, even though the graphics are no way near today’s standards, this game was literally a game changer. You play as the scientist Gordon Freeman who accidentally gets caught up in a government experiment at the Black Mesa Research Facility, and guess what…. something goes wrong. Battle your way out of the facility against aliens and monsters but help is on hand, the marines are coming. If only that simple, even the marines are against you.

To begin with you are armed with a trusty crowbar; additional weapons are found throughout the game including some alien technology. Plenty of levels to complete with an all-encompassing genre of FPS, platformers and puzzles. At times the platform aspects can be annoying, but aren’t they all at times, some of the puzzles you have to solve range from easy to just accidentally stumble on the correct solution, but none of this detracts away from the game play.

Did I mention this was 20 years old and a classic, oh yes I did. In addition it is worth checking out the HL community as there are some incredible mods out there to breathe new life in to this game. Overall this is a must have game, a piece of gaming history which still holds its own and has a huge following behind it.

Now where did I leave my glasses, (I am sure I did not need these 20 years ago) as I am about to revisit Half-Life Blue Shift and play as Barney and make up for all the times I left him to die or got him killed during Half-Life.

시대에 뒤쳐진 그래픽 때문에 시작하기가 꺼려지지만, 일단 시작한 후에는 절대 손에서 놓을 수 없는 게임. 옛 말투에 귀를 맡기고 과학자들에게 말을 걸고 다니다 보면, 그들의 찰진 말투에 이야기에 자연스레 빠져들게 된다. 1998년 게임이지만, 여러가지 시스템들은 감탄을 자아내게 한다. 예를 들어서 자판기에 대고 "사용"키를 누르면 버튼이 하나 하나 눌리며 음료가 나오게 된다. 또한, 자판기를 부수면 음료들이 쏟아져 나와 아름다운 광경을 보인다. 그중에서도 가장 재밌는 부분은 실험실의 전원을 내리는 것, 실험실의 불을 끄면 "자네, 뭐하는건가?"하면서 불을 다시 키러 온다. 역시 갓겜은 죽지 않는다. 그래서 핲라 3는....
上车补票再来一次！！！

Большое кол-во оружия,гемплей выживалка так как патронов иной раз мизерное кол-во.
вообщем легенда игростроя!
